qas.question: Where did Louis XVI and his family live?
When did Napoleon Bonaparte gain power as the First Consul?
Approximately how many people were executed during the Reign of Terror?

context: Louis XVI and the royal family were brought to Paris and made virtual prisoners within the <a0_0>Tuileries Palace<a0_0/>. In 1793, as the revolution turned more and more radical, the king, queen, and the mayor were guillotined, along with more than <a2_0>16,000<a2_0/> others (throughout France), during the Reign of Terror. The property of the aristocracy and the church was nationalised, and the city's churches were closed, sold or demolished. A succession of revolutionary factions ruled Paris until <a1_0>9 November 1799<a1_0/> (coup d'état du 18 brumaire), when Napoléon Bonaparte seized power as First Consul.
